newsitem.title: USA: Desktop sees 1997 revs lower than expected.
newsitem.headline: Desktop sees 1997 revs lower than expected.

text.p: Desktop Data Inc said Thursday it expects revenue growth for full 1997 to be in the 23 percent to 25 percent range, compared with 46 percent in 1996 "and less than we anticipated previously."
The company said it plans to continue to invest in development, support and sales resources at planned levels to address the wider market opportunity and increased competition.
These 1997 plans represent an acceleration in hiring and expenses relative to last year, Desktop said.

As a consequence, the company said it anticipates that its 1997 operating profit margin is likely to be in the three percent to five percent range, compared with 9.8 percent last year and less than the company anticipated previously.

During the first quarter of 1997 the company reorganized its sales force to accommodate more growth and address changing market conditions. As a result, the company experienced a lower than anticipated level of order bookings during the first quarter of 1997.

With the visibility provided by its subscription based revenue model, the Desktop said it believes the near term result of these trends will be lower than anticipated revenue growth for the remainder of this fiscal year.
